storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view real-time attendance status on dashboard to achieve immediate workforce visibility

testCases.title: Validate real-time attendance data display on dashboard
preconditions: User has valid Manager credentials
Attendance database contains current day employee check-in/out records
Dashboard application is accessible and running
Network connectivity is stable
Browser is compatible (Chrome, Firefox, Edge latest versions)

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid Manager credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and redirected to the main dashboard

steps.action: Click on the attendance dashboard menu option
steps.expectedResult: Attendance dashboard loads displaying current attendance data including employee check-in/out status, department-wise summary, and visual indicators for absent/late employees

steps.action: Verify the timestamp of the data displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows current timestamp indicating data freshness and real-time status

steps.action: Note the current attendance count and wait for 60 seconds without any user interaction
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically refreshes after 60 seconds, timestamp updates to current time, and any new check-in/out data is reflected in the display

steps.action: Select a specific department from the department filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates immediately to display only attendance data for the selected department, showing filtered employee records and department-specific summary

steps.action: Verify that the filtered data matches the selected department criteria
steps.expectedResult: All displayed employee records belong to the selected department and summary statistics reflect only that department's data

postconditions: Dashboard remains in filtered view with selected department
Auto-refresh continues to function every 60 seconds
Manager session remains active
No data corruption or system errors logged

testCases.title: Verify export of attendance dashboard reports
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system
Attendance dashboard is loaded with current data
Export functionality is enabled for Manager role
Browser allows file downloads
Sufficient disk space available for downloads

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export' button on the attendance dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears showing PDF and Excel format options

steps.action: Select 'Export as PDF' option from the export menu
steps.expectedResult: PDF report generation process initiates, progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for PDF generation to complete and verify the download
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is successfully downloaded to the default download location with filename containing 'Attendance_Dashboard' and current date

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains all visible dashboard data including attendance summary, employee status, department breakdown, and timestamp matching the dashboard view

steps.action: Return to the dashboard and click the 'Export' button again
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu appears again

steps.action: Select 'Export as Excel' option from the export menu
steps.expectedResult: Excel report generation process initiates, progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for Excel generation to complete and verify the download
steps.expectedResult: Excel file (.xlsx) is successfully downloaded to the default download location with filename containing 'Attendance_Dashboard' and current date

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: Excel file contains all dashboard data in structured format with proper columns for employee name, department, check-in time, check-out time, status, and summary sheets matching the dashboard view

postconditions: Two report files (PDF and Excel) are saved in download location
Dashboard remains in current state without data loss
Export functionality remains available for subsequent use
No temporary files left in system cache

testCases.title: Test dashboard load performance
preconditions: Manager has valid login credentials
System is under normal load conditions (baseline user activity)
Network latency is within acceptable range (<100ms)
Database contains representative attendance data
Performance monitoring tools are available to measure load time

steps.action: Clear browser cache and cookies to ensure clean test environment
steps.expectedResult: Browser cache and cookies are cleared successfully

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor page load metrics
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and ready to capture performance metrics

steps.action: Navigate to the login page and enter valid Manager credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager is authenticated successfully

steps.action: Start the performance timer and click on the attendance dashboard menu option
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loading process begins, loading indicator is displayed

steps.action: Monitor the dashboard loading process until all elements are fully rendered
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard completes loading with all components visible including charts, tables, summary cards, and filter controls

steps.action: Check the Network tab in developer tools and note the total page load time from initial request to DOM content loaded
steps.expectedResult: Total dashboard load time is 3 seconds or less, all API calls return successfully with status 200

steps.action: Verify that all dashboard elements are interactive and data is fully populated
steps.expectedResult: All attendance data is displayed correctly, filters are functional, and no loading spinners or placeholders remain visible

steps.action: Repeat steps 1-7 two more times to ensure consistent performance
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads within 3 seconds in all three test iterations under normal load conditions

postconditions: Dashboard is fully loaded and functional
Performance metrics are documented
System remains stable with no memory leaks
All API endpoints responded within acceptable time limits

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to filter attendance dashboard by department and date to achieve focused insights

testCases.title: Validate filtering by department and date range
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system with appropriate permissions
Attendance dashboard is loaded and displaying full data set
Multiple departments exist in the system with attendance records
Attendance data exists for multiple dates
Filter controls are visible and enabled on the dashboard

steps.action: Locate the department filter dropdown on the attendance dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Department dropdown is visible and displays placeholder text 'Select Department' or shows 'All Departments'

steps.action: Click on the department dropdown to expand the list of available departments
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown expands showing a complete list of all departments in the organization

steps.action: Select a valid department (e.g., 'Engineering') from the dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Selected department is highlighted and displayed in the dropdown field

steps.action: Locate the date range picker control on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Date range picker is visible with 'From Date' and 'To Date' fields or a calendar icon

steps.action: Click on the date range picker and select a valid date range (e.g., last 7 days)
steps.expectedResult: Calendar interface opens, selected date range is highlighted and displayed in the date fields

steps.action: Click 'Apply' or wait for auto-apply of filters
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates within 2 seconds showing loading indicator, then displays filtered attendance data for the selected department and date range

steps.action: Examine the employee records displayed in the dashboard table
steps.expectedResult: All displayed employee records belong to the selected department (Engineering) only

steps.action: Verify the dates of all attendance records shown in the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: All attendance records fall within the selected date range, no records outside the range are displayed

steps.action: Check the summary statistics and visualizations on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Summary cards, charts, and graphs reflect only the filtered data (selected department and date range), totals and percentages are recalculated accordingly

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Reset Filters' or 'Clear All' button
steps.expectedResult: Reset button is clicked successfully

steps.action: Observe the dashboard behavior after clicking reset
steps.expectedResult: All filter selections are cleared (department shows 'All Departments', date range resets to default), dashboard reloads and displays the full attendance data set for all departments and default date range

steps.action: Verify the record count and summary statistics after reset
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows complete unfiltered data with total record count matching the original state before filtering

postconditions: Dashboard displays full unfiltered data set
All filter controls are reset to default state
No filter criteria are applied
Dashboard performance remains optimal
Filter state is ready for next filtering operation

testCases.title: Verify filter input validation
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system
Attendance dashboard is loaded and accessible
Filter controls are enabled and visible
Validation rules are configured for department and date inputs

steps.action: Locate the department filter dropdown on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Department dropdown is visible and accessible

steps.action: Attempt to manually enter an invalid or non-existent department name in the department filter (if text input is allowed) or use browser console to inject invalid department value
steps.expectedResult: System detects invalid department input

steps.action: Observe the system response to invalid department input
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed (e.g., 'Invalid department selected' or 'Department does not exist'), error message is shown in red or with warning icon, filter is not applied, dashboard data remains unchanged

steps.action: Clear the invalid department input and locate the date range picker
steps.expectedResult: Error message clears, date range picker is accessible

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format in the 'From Date' field (e.g., '99/99/9999' or 'invalid-date')
steps.expectedResult: Date field accepts the input or shows inline validation

steps.action: Attempt to apply the filter with invalid date format
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed (e.g., 'Invalid date format. Please use MM/DD/YYYY'), error is highlighted on the date field, filter query is prevented from executing, dashboard data remains unchanged

steps.action: Clear the invalid date and enter a valid 'From Date' but enter a 'To Date' that is earlier than 'From Date' (e.g., From: 01/15/2024, To: 01/10/2024)
steps.expectedResult: Both dates are entered in the fields

steps.action: Attempt to apply the filter with invalid date range (To Date before From Date)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed (e.g., 'End date must be after start date' or 'Invalid date range'), error is highlighted on the date range picker, filter query is prevented from executing, dashboard data remains unchanged

steps.action: Enter a future date in the date range picker (e.g., a date 30 days from today)
steps.expectedResult: Future date is entered in the field

steps.action: Attempt to apply the filter with future date
steps.expectedResult: System either displays validation warning (e.g., 'Future dates selected - no data available') or allows the query but returns empty results with appropriate message, no system error occurs, dashboard handles the scenario gracefully

steps.action: Verify that no database query was executed for any of the invalid input scenarios
steps.expectedResult: Network tab in browser developer tools shows no API calls were made for invalid filter attempts, system prevented unnecessary database queries

postconditions: Dashboard remains in stable state with original data displayed
No invalid data was queried from the database
All validation error messages are cleared when valid inputs are provided
Filter controls are ready for valid input
No system errors or exceptions are logged

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to export attendance dashboard reports to achieve offline analysis and sharing

testCases.title: Validate export of filtered dashboard data to PDF and Excel
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Attendance dashboard is accessible and loaded
Attendance data exists in the system for the selected time period
Browser has download permissions enabled
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard page
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully displaying attendance data with available filter options

steps.action: Apply date range filter by selecting start date and end date from the filter panel
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates and displays attendance data only for the selected date range

steps.action: Apply department filter by selecting a specific department from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes and shows attendance data filtered by the selected department

steps.action: Verify that charts and tabular data reflect the applied filters
steps.expectedResult: All visible charts and tables display data matching the applied filter criteria

steps.action: Click on the 'Export' button located on the dashboard toolbar
steps.expectedResult: Export format selection dialog appears with PDF and Excel options

steps.action: Select 'PDF' format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: System initiates PDF generation process and shows loading indicator

steps.action: Wait for the PDF file to be generated and downloaded
steps.expectedResult: PDF file downloads successfully to the default download location within 10 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains all visible charts, tabular data, and reflects the applied filters with proper formatting and readability

steps.action: Return to the dashboard and click the 'Export' button again
steps.expectedResult: Export format selection dialog appears again

steps.action: Select 'Excel' format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: System initiates Excel generation process and shows loading indicator

steps.action: Wait for the Excel file to be generated and downloaded
steps.expectedResult: Excel file downloads successfully to the default download location within 10 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: Excel file contains all tabular data in structured format with proper column headers, reflects applied filters, and data is accurate and readable

postconditions: Two export files (PDF and Excel) are saved in the download folder
Dashboard remains in the same filtered state
User session remains active
No errors are logged in the system

testCases.title: Verify export generation time and confirmation
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Attendance dashboard is loaded with data
System is under normal load conditions
Browser has download permissions enabled
Timer or stopwatch is available to measure export time

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully with attendance data displayed

steps.action: Apply any filter to the dashboard (e.g., select a date range)
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates with filtered data

steps.action: Click on the 'Export' button and note the current time
steps.expectedResult: Export format selection dialog appears

steps.action: Select 'PDF' format and start timing the export process
steps.expectedResult: System begins generating the PDF export and displays a loading indicator

steps.action: Monitor the export generation process and measure the time taken
steps.expectedResult: Export generation completes within 10 seconds from the moment of format selection

steps.action: Observe the system response after export completion
steps.expectedResult: System displays a confirmation message such as 'Export successful' or 'Report downloaded successfully'

steps.action: Verify the confirmation message contains relevant information
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message includes file name, format, and success status

steps.action: Check the download folder for the exported file
steps.expectedResult: Exported PDF file is present in the download folder with correct naming convention and timestamp

steps.action: Repeat the export process with Excel format and measure the time
steps.expectedResult: Excel export completes within 10 seconds and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the Excel file is downloaded successfully
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is present in the download folder and confirmation message was displayed

postconditions: Export files are successfully downloaded
Confirmation messages were displayed for both exports
Export generation time was within acceptable limits (under 10 seconds)
Dashboard remains functional and responsive
No error messages or system issues occurred

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view employee punctuality trends to achieve better attendance insights

testCases.title: Validate punctuality trend chart display and filtering
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Dashboard is accessible and loaded
Attendance data with timestamps exists in the system
Multiple employees and departments have attendance records
Punctuality trend feature is enabled for the manager role

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard page
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully and displays punctuality trend charts section

steps.action: Verify that punctuality trend charts are visible on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Punctuality trend charts are displayed showing data over time with proper axis labels and legends

steps.action: Locate the employee filter dropdown in the punctuality section
steps.expectedResult: Employee filter dropdown is visible and contains a list of employees

steps.action: Select a specific employee from the employee filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Punctuality trend chart updates within 3 seconds to display data only for the selected employee

steps.action: Verify the chart data matches the selected employee's attendance records
steps.expectedResult: Chart displays accurate punctuality data including on-time arrivals, late arrivals, and timestamps for the selected employee

steps.action: Locate the department filter dropdown in the punctuality section
steps.expectedResult: Department filter dropdown is visible and contains a list of departments

steps.action: Select a specific department from the department filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Punctuality trend chart updates within 3 seconds to display aggregated data for all employees in the selected department

steps.action: Verify the chart reflects department-level punctuality trends
steps.expectedResult: Chart shows punctuality trends for the selected department with accurate data aggregation

steps.action: Locate and review the summary statistics section on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Summary statistics are displayed including metrics such as average late arrivals, total late days, punctuality percentage, and on-time percentage

steps.action: Manually calculate or cross-reference summary statistics with raw attendance data
steps.expectedResult: Summary statistics match the actual attendance data with 95% or higher accuracy

steps.action: Verify that statistics update when filters are changed
steps.expectedResult: Summary statistics dynamically update to reflect the currently applied employee or department filter

steps.action: Click on the 'Export' button in the punctuality trend section
steps.expectedResult: Export format selection dialog appears with PDF and Excel options

steps.action: Select 'PDF' format and initiate the export
steps.expectedResult: PDF trend report is generated and downloaded successfully within 10 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF report and verify its contents
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains punctuality trend charts, summary statistics, and reflects the currently applied filters with proper formatting

steps.action: Return to dashboard and export the trend report in Excel format
steps.expectedResult: Excel trend report is generated and downloaded successfully with tabular punctuality data

steps.action: Open the Excel file and verify data accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Excel file contains detailed punctuality data in structured format matching the dashboard display and applied filters

postconditions: Punctuality trend charts are displayed with accurate filtered data
Summary statistics reflect the applied filters
Export files (PDF and Excel) are saved successfully
Dashboard remains in filtered state
No errors occurred during filtering or export operations

testCases.title: Test real-time update of punctuality data
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Dashboard is loaded and displaying punctuality trend charts
System has real-time data refresh capability enabled
Test environment allows simulation of new attendance entries
Access to create or simulate attendance data entries is available

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance dashboard and locate the punctuality trend charts
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully with punctuality trend charts visible showing current data

steps.action: Note the current data displayed in the punctuality trend chart including the latest timestamp and data points
steps.expectedResult: Current punctuality data is visible and documented for comparison

steps.action: Open a separate browser tab or use admin interface to access attendance data entry
steps.expectedResult: Attendance data entry interface is accessible

steps.action: Create a new attendance entry for an employee with a timestamp indicating late arrival (e.g., 15 minutes after scheduled start time)
steps.expectedResult: New attendance record is successfully created and saved in the system

steps.action: Return to the dashboard tab with punctuality trend charts
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is still active and displaying the previous data state

steps.action: Wait and observe the punctuality trend chart for automatic updates (monitor for up to 60 seconds)
steps.expectedResult: Punctuality trend chart automatically refreshes and updates to include the newly entered attendance data within 60 seconds

steps.action: Verify that the new data point appears on the trend chart
steps.expectedResult: New late arrival is reflected in the chart with correct timestamp and punctuality status

steps.action: Check if summary statistics have updated to reflect the new attendance entry
steps.expectedResult: Summary statistics such as average late arrivals and punctuality percentage are recalculated and updated to include the new data

steps.action: Simulate another attendance entry with on-time arrival
steps.expectedResult: Second attendance record is successfully created in the system

steps.action: Monitor the dashboard for the second real-time update
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates within 60 seconds to reflect the second attendance entry with accurate punctuality status

steps.action: Verify data consistency across all chart elements and statistics
steps.expectedResult: All charts, graphs, and summary statistics consistently reflect the updated attendance data with no discrepancies

postconditions: Punctuality trend charts display the most recent attendance data
Summary statistics are updated and accurate
Real-time refresh functionality is confirmed working
New attendance entries are visible on the dashboard
System performance remains stable during real-time updates

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view employee presence heatmaps to achieve spatial attendance insights

testCases.title: Validate heatmap display and filtering
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Dashboard is accessible and loaded
Attendance location data exists for multiple dates and departments
Browser supports PNG image downloads
User has role-based access to view heatmaps

steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard page
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully and heatmap visualization section is visible

steps.action: Locate the date filter dropdown on the heatmap section
steps.expectedResult: Date filter dropdown is displayed with available date options

steps.action: Select a specific date from the date filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected date is highlighted and heatmap begins to update

steps.action: Locate the department filter dropdown on the heatmap section
steps.expectedResult: Department filter dropdown is displayed with available department options

steps.action: Select a specific department from the department filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected department is highlighted and heatmap updates to reflect filtered data with color-coded presence intensity for the selected date and department

steps.action: Verify the heatmap displays color-coded presence data matching the applied filters
steps.expectedResult: Heatmap shows accurate employee presence intensity with appropriate color gradients representing different presence levels for the filtered date and department

steps.action: Use mouse scroll or zoom controls to zoom into a specific area of the heatmap
steps.expectedResult: Heatmap zooms in smoothly, showing more detailed view of the selected area with maintained visual clarity

steps.action: Hover mouse cursor over a specific location on the heatmap
steps.expectedResult: Tooltip or popup appears displaying detailed presence information including location name, number of employees present, department, and timestamp

steps.action: Move cursor to different locations on the heatmap
steps.expectedResult: Hover details update dynamically showing relevant information for each hovered location

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export' or 'Download' button for the heatmap
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears or download process initiates

steps.action: Confirm the export action if prompted and wait for download to complete
steps.expectedResult: PNG image file downloads successfully to the default download location

steps.action: Open the downloaded PNG file
steps.expectedResult: PNG image opens correctly displaying the heatmap visualization with all applied filters and current zoom level preserved

postconditions: Heatmap remains displayed with applied filters
PNG image file is saved in downloads folder
User session remains active
No errors are logged in the system

testCases.title: Test heatmap load performance
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
System is under normal load conditions (not peak hours)
Network connection is stable with normal bandwidth
Attendance location data is available in the database
Browser cache is cleared to ensure accurate load time measurement
Performance monitoring tools are ready (browser developer tools or stopwatch)

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor load times
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools open successfully and Network tab is active with recording enabled

steps.action: Start timer or note the current timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Timer is started and ready to measure load time

steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard page containing the heatmap visualization
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard page begins loading and API call to GET /api/dashboard/heatmap is initiated

steps.action: Wait for the heatmap visualization to fully render with all visual elements displayed
steps.expectedResult: Heatmap visualization loads completely with color-coded presence data, all interactive elements are functional, and loading indicators disappear

steps.action: Stop timer and record the total load time from navigation to full render
steps.expectedResult: Total load time is recorded and is 4 seconds or less

steps.action: Verify in Network tab that GET /api/dashboard/heatmap API call completed successfully with 200 status code
